Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Polymerize \Pol"y*mer*ize\, v. i. (Chem.) To change into another substance having the same atomic proportions, but a higher molecular weight; to undergo polymerization; thus, aldehyde polymerizes in forming paraldehyde. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Polymerize \Pol"y*mer*ize\, v. t. (Chem.) To cause polymerization of; to produce polymers from; to increase the molecular weight of, without changing the atomic proportions; thus, certain acids polymerize aldehyde. [1913 Webster]
polymerize v 1: cause (a compound) to polymerize [syn: {polymerise}] 2: undergo polymerization [syn: {polymerise}]
